Class OrderController

java.lang.Object
team4s.OrderController
public class OrderController extends Object

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addToOrder(String side)
    Adds a plate with the selected side and entrees to the order and updates the total price.
    void
    addToOrderAppetizer(String item)
    Adds an appetizer to the order if it has available servings, and updates the total price.
    void
    addToOrderDisposable(String disposableName)
    Adds a disposable item to the current order and updates the inventory by subtracting one serving from the stock.

    Cancels the current order by clearing the order list, resetting selections, and setting the total to zero.

    Checks if sufficient ingredients are available in the inventory to restock servings for a menu item.

    Changes the color of an entree button based on the number of times it has been selected.

    Confirms the current order by displaying a dialog with order details and payment type options.

    Decrements the stock of an ingredient in the inventory by the specified amount.

  • Constructor Details

    • OrderController

      public OrderController()

  • Method Details

    • goBackToMainMenu

      public void goBackToMainMenu()
      Handles the action when the "Go Back" button is clicked. This method loads the main menu by switching the scene from the current order page. It uses the FXMLLoader to load the FXML file for the main menu and sets the new scene on the stage. If an IOException occurs during loading, it is caught and logged, displaying an error alert.

    • showEmployeeSelectionDialog

      public void showEmployeeSelectionDialog()
      Displays a dialog to allow the selection of an employee from a list. The selected employee's ID is stored and their name is shown in the UI.

    • loadEmployeesFromDatabase

      public Map<String,Integer> loadEmployeesFromDatabase()
      Loads employee data from the database and returns a map of employee names to IDs.
      Returns:
      a map where the keys are employee names and the values are their corresponding IDs.

    • selectBowl

      public void selectBowl()
      Handles the event when the "Bowl" button is clicked. This method sets the selected plate type to "Bowl".

    • selectPlate

      public void selectPlate()
      Handles the event when the "Plate" button is clicked. This method sets the selected plate type to "Plate".

    • selectBiggerPlate

      public void selectBiggerPlate()
      Handles the event when the "Bigger Plate" button is clicked. This method sets the selected plate type to "Bigger Plate".

    • selectAppetizer

      public void selectAppetizer()
      Handles the event when the "Appetizer" button is clicked. This method resets the button styles and loads the available appetizer items.

    • selectDrinks

      public void selectDrinks()
      Handles the event when the "Drinks" button is clicked. This method resets the button styles and loads the available drink items.

    • selectSide

      public void selectSide()
      Handles the event when the "Side" button is clicked. This method resets the button styles and loads the available side items.

    • selectEntree

      public void selectEntree()
      Handles the event when the "Entree" button is clicked. This method resets the button styles and loads the available entree items.

    • selectDisposables

      public void selectDisposables()
      Handles the event when the "Disposables" button is clicked. This method resets the button styles and loads the available disposable items from the inventory.

    • loadDisposables

      public void loadDisposables()
      Loads disposable items from the inventory table and dynamically creates buttons for each item. These items are displayed on the UI, allowing the user to select a disposable item for the order.

    • addToOrderDisposable

      public void addToOrderDisposable(String disposableName)
      Adds a disposable item to the current order and updates the inventory by subtracting one serving from the stock.
      Parameters:
      disposableName - the name of the disposable item being added to the order.

    • updateInventoryServing

      public void updateInventoryServing(String itemName, int servingsUsed)
      Fetches the menu_item_id from the menu_item table based on the item's name.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the menu item.
      servingsUsed - the number of servings used for the item.

    • getMenuItemId

      public int getMenuItemId(String itemName)
      Fetches the menu_item_id from the menu_item table based on the item's name.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the menu item.
      Returns:
      the ID of the menu item, or -1 if the item is not found.

    • requestRestockForMenuItem

      public void requestRestockForMenuItem()
      Handles the request to restock servings for a selected menu item (entree or side). Ensures that sufficient ingredients are available before performing the restock operation.

    • canRestockServings

      public boolean canRestockServings(int menuItemId)
      Checks if sufficient ingredients are available in the inventory to restock servings for a menu item.
      Parameters:
      menuItemId - the ID of the menu item to restock.
      Returns:
      true if ingredients are available, false otherwise.

    • getAvailableServings

      public int getAvailableServings(String itemName)
      Retrieves the available servings for a specified menu item from the database.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the menu item.
      Returns:
      the number of available servings for the item, or 0 if not found.

    • hasEnoughIngredients

      public boolean hasEnoughIngredients(int ingredientId, double amountNeeded)
      Checks if there are enough ingredients in the inventory to meet the specified requirement.
      Parameters:
      ingredientId - the ID of the ingredient.
      amountNeeded - the required amount of the ingredient.
      Returns:
      true if the current stock is sufficient, false otherwise.

    • restockServings

      public void restockServings(int menuItemId)
      Restocks servings for a menu item by decrementing the inventory and increasing the available servings.
      Parameters:
      menuItemId - the ID of the menu item to restock.

    • decrementInventory

      public void decrementInventory(int ingredientId, double amountUsed)
      Decrements the stock of an ingredient in the inventory by the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      ingredientId - the ID of the ingredient to update.
      amountUsed - the amount to subtract from the current stock.

    • selectPlate

      public void selectPlate(String plateType)
      Handles the plate selection for the given plate type and updates the UI.
      Parameters:
      plateType - the type of plate selected (e.g., "Bowl", "Plate", "Bigger Plate").

    • resetButtonStyles

      public void resetButtonStyles()
      Resets the styles of all buttons to their default state.

    • showSideButtons

      public void showSideButtons()
      Loads side options from the menu_item table and dynamically creates buttons for each available side.

    • loadEntreeButtons

      public void loadEntreeButtons(String selectedSide)
      Loads entree options based on the selected side and dynamically creates buttons for each available entree.
      Parameters:
      selectedSide - the name of the selected side.

    • handleEntreeSelection

      public void handleEntreeSelection(javafx.scene.control.Button entreeButton, String entreeName)
      Handles the selection of an entree, ensuring the maximum number of entrees for the selected plate type is not exceeded. Updates the UI to reflect the selected entrees.
      Parameters:
      entreeButton - the button representing the selected entree.
      entreeName - the name of the selected entree.

    • changeButtonColor

      public void changeButtonColor(javafx.scene.control.Button entreeButton, int count)
      Changes the color of an entree button based on the number of times it has been selected.
      Parameters:
      entreeButton - the button representing the entree.
      count - the number of times the entree has been selected.

    • addToOrder

      public void addToOrder(String side)
      Adds a plate with the selected side and entrees to the order and updates the total price.
      Parameters:
      side - the name of the selected side.

    • addToOrderAppetizer

      public void addToOrderAppetizer(String item)
      Adds an appetizer to the order if it has available servings, and updates the total price. If no servings are available, an alert is shown.
      Parameters:
      item - the name of the appetizer to add.

    • addToOrderDrink

      public void addToOrderDrink(String item)
      Adds a drink to the current order and updates the total price.
      Parameters:
      item - the name of the drink to be added.

    • addToOrderSide

      public void addToOrderSide(String side)
      Adds a side to the current order and updates the total price.
      Parameters:
      side - the name of the side to be added.

    • addToOrderEntree

      public void addToOrderEntree(String entree)
      Adds an entree to the current order and updates the total price.
      Parameters:
      entree - the name of the entree to be added.

    • fetchPriceFromDatabase

      public double fetchPriceFromDatabase(String itemName)
      Fetches the price of an item from the database.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the item to fetch the price for.
      Returns:
      the price of the item, or 0.0 if not found.

    • updateOrderTotal

      public void updateOrderTotal()
      Updates the order total in the UI.

    • resetSelections

      public void resetSelections()
      Resets all selections, clearing selected entrees, side, and dynamic buttons.

    • loadItems

      public void loadItems(String category)
      Loads menu items (such as sides, entrees, drinks, or appetizers) based on their category and dynamically adds buttons to the UI for user selection.
      Parameters:
      category - the category of items to load (e.g., "Side", "Entree", "Drink", "Appetizer").

    • confirmOrder

      public void confirmOrder()
      Confirms the current order by displaying a dialog with order details and payment type options. The order is then placed in the database with the selected payment type.

    • deleteSelectedItem

      public void deleteSelectedItem()
      Deletes the selected item from the current order, updates the total price, and removes the item from the UI.

    • calculateOrderItemPrice

      public double calculateOrderItemPrice(String orderItem)
      Calculates the price of a specific order item.
      Parameters:
      orderItem - the string representing the order item.
      Returns:
      the total price of the order item.

    • editSelectedItem

      public void editSelectedItem()
      Edits the selected item from the current order. Opens the appropriate selection dialog based on the type of item selected (Appetizer, Drink, Side, Entree, or Plate).

    • showSelectionDialog

      public void showSelectionDialog(String type, String itemType, String preFillItem)
      Displays a selection dialog for editing an item (Appetizer or Drink). Loads the items into a ComboBox for user selection.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of the item to edit (Appetizer or Drink).
      itemType - the category of the item being edited.
      preFillItem - the name of the item to pre-fill in the selection dialog.

    • updateAppetizerOrder

      public void updateAppetizerOrder(String appetizer)
      Updates the current order with the new selected appetizer.
      Parameters:
      appetizer - the name of the selected appetizer.

    • updateDrinkOrder

      public void updateDrinkOrder(String drink)
      Updates the current order with the new selected drink.
      Parameters:
      drink - the name of the selected drink.

    • showAlert

      public void showAlert(String title, String message)
      Displays an alert dialog with the provided title and message.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the alert dialog.
      message - the message content of the alert dialog.

    • showSelectionDialog

      public void showSelectionDialog(String type, String itemType, int maxEntrees, String preFillSide, List<String> preFillEntrees)
      Displays a selection dialog for editing an item (Plate, Side, or Entree). Allows the user to edit a plate order by choosing the side and entrees.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of the item to edit (Plate).
      itemType - the category of the item being edited (Side or Entree).
      maxEntrees - the maximum number of entrees allowed for the plate.
      preFillSide - the side to pre-fill in the selection dialog.
      preFillEntrees - the entrees to pre-fill in the selection dialog.

    • updateOrder

      public void updateOrder(String side, List<String> entrees)
      Updates the current order at the selected index with the new side and entrees.
      Parameters:
      side - the new selected side.
      entrees - the list of new selected entrees.

    • loadComboBoxItems

      public void loadComboBoxItems(String category, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> comboBox)
      Loads items into the provided ComboBox based on the specified category.
      Parameters:
      category - the category of items to load (e.g., Side, Entree).
      comboBox - the ComboBox to populate with items from the database.

    • cancelOrder

      public void cancelOrder()
      Cancels the current order by clearing the order list, resetting selections, and setting the total to zero.

    • increaseItemQuantity

      public void increaseItemQuantity()
      Increases the quantity of the selected item in the order by prompting the user for a new quantity. Updates the total cost based on the new quantity.

    • handleConfirmButton

      public void handleConfirmButton()
      Handles the confirmation of the order by verifying that an employee is selected, displaying a summary of the order and payment type options, and placing the order in the database.

    • extractItemQuantity

      public int extractItemQuantity(String orderItem)
      Extracts the item quantity from the order string (e.g., "Entree (Chicken) x2").
      Parameters:
      orderItem - the order item string.
      Returns:
      the quantity of the item, or 1 if no quantity is specified.

    • placeOrderInDatabase

      public void placeOrderInDatabase(double totalWithTax, String paymentType)
      Places the current order in the database by creating a transaction entry and updating the inventory and menu item serving counts for each item in the order.
      Parameters:
      totalWithTax - the total cost of the order including tax.
      paymentType - the selected payment type (e.g., Credit/Debit, Dining Dollars, Gift Card).

    • updateMenuItemServing

      public void updateMenuItemServing(String itemName, int servingsUsed)
      Updates the menu_item table by subtracting the number of servings used for the specified item.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the item in the menu.
      servingsUsed - the number of servings to subtract from the menu item's available servings.

    • extractItemName

      public String extractItemName(String orderItem)
      Extracts the item name from the order string.
      Parameters:
      orderItem - the order string that contains the item name.
      Returns:
      the extracted item name from the order string.

    • fetchMenuItemId

      public int fetchMenuItemId(String itemName)
      Fetches the menu item ID from the menu_item table based on the item name.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name of the item for which to fetch the menu item ID.
      Returns:
      the menu item ID, or -1 if the item is not found in the database.

    • showCustomerDialog

      public void showCustomerDialog()
      Displays a dialog to either select an existing customer or add a new customer. If an existing customer is selected, their details are auto-filled. A new customer can also be added manually.

    • loadCustomersFromDatabase

      public Map<String,Integer> loadCustomersFromDatabase()
      Loads the list of customers from the customer table in the database into a map, mapping customer names to their IDs.
      Returns:
      a map of customer names and their corresponding customer IDs.

    • loadCustomerDetails

      public void loadCustomerDetails(int customerId, javafx.scene.control.TextField firstNameField, javafx.scene.control.TextField lastNameField, javafx.scene.control.TextField emailField, javafx.scene.control.TextField phoneField)
      Loads the details of a customer from the database and fills the provided text fields with the customer's data.
      Parameters:
      customerId - the ID of the customer to load details for.
      firstNameField - the text field for the customer's first name.
      lastNameField - the text field for the customer's last name.
      emailField - the text field for the customer's email.
      phoneField - the text field for the customer's phone number.

    • saveNewCustomer

      public void saveNewCustomer(String firstName, String lastName, String email, String phone)
      Saves a new customer to the database by inserting their details into the customer table.
      Parameters:
      firstName - the first name of the new customer.
      lastName - the last name of the new customer.
      email - the email address of the new customer.
      phone - the phone number of the new customer.
